wikipedia_page.main: Margaret Ann Barton (born 27 May 1926 in Finsbury Park, London, England) is a retired British actress. She is best known for her role in the 1945 David Lean film Brief Encounter in which she played Beryl Walters, a girl who works in the railway station cafe.

response: Christie wrote the play during the period of the final rehearsals for Witness for the ProsecutionMorgan, Janet Agatha Christie, A Biography (p. 297) Collins, 1984; , which opened to rave reviews in London on 28 October 1953. Lockwood's character was given the name of Clarissa, the name of Christie's beloved mother who had died back in 1926. Unasked, Christie also wrote a role which would be suitable for Lockwood's fourteen-year-old daughter, Julia, although Margaret Barton played the part in the finished production.
* Margaret Barton as Pippa Hailsham-Brown, Clarissa's young stepdaughter
* Margaret Barton as Rosemary – Rick's Sister
*Beryl Walters, played by Margaret Barton in the film, a character in the play Still Life and film Brief Encounter by Noël Coward

It premiered at the Lyceum Theatre, Edinburgh before transferring to the Winter Garden Theatre in London's West End where it ran for 140 performances between 11 September 1945 and 3 January 1946. The original West End cast included Peter Hammond, Ivan Samson, Tom Gill, Margaret Barton, Elliott Mason, Joan Haythorne and Leueen MacGrath.Wearing p.208
